reviews.text: I wanted steak and this place was open not to far from my house I ordered the Rib Eye medium and it was really good I will definitely be going back

Don‚Äôt get me wrong the atmosphere and food are amazing, but the overall service is horrible for the price you‚Äôre paying. "BX Steakhouse in the Bronx is a hidden gem, one of the needles found in a haystack. In a town overflowing with Dominican cuisine, this spot stands out as a top-notch destination for steak lovers. The ambience is exceptional, the service is top-tier, and the drinks are expertly crafted. But it's the food that's truly out of this world. The steaks are made from quality beef, cooked to perfection, and paired with incredible sauces and side dishes that will leave you speechless. I had the carpaccio, and I can confidently say it's one of the best I've ever tasted. If you're looking for a dining experience that will exceed your expectations, look no further than BX Steakhouse. You won't be disappointed!"

BX Steakhouse hands down served me the best steak in the city. Perfectly cooked, full of flavor, and absolutely unforgettable. After this meal, I‚Äôm convinced‚ÄîI‚Äôll never leave the Bronx again. A must-visit for serious steak lovers.

The service was excellent, the drinks were strong, the scene was ambient but the food left much to be desired.

We were mostly satisfied with the apps. The crab cake was a bit overcooked outside but the inside was great. Lobster Mac and cheese was really good, had lots of lobster. Salads were good.

The steaks tho, none of us were satisfied with. We all ordered rare or medium rare and all were overcooked.

The mash, no one touched. Super dry and smelled funny. Tasted like boxed mash,
not steakhouse mash.

Bill was $430 for 4 adults, 2 kids with 5  entrees, 4 apps, 3 alcoholic drinks, 3 non-alch drinks, and sides were included with entrees, so price wise, this place is a steal. It‚Äôs smaller budget friendly, but a steakhouse is a steakhouse so it‚Äôll cost over $100 easily for 1-2 persons.

We chose this spot because we wanted to support small local business in the Bronx  but unlikely we will return.

I was drinking beer (which they were great) .I had to call to the bartender (erma?) Multiple times to get me a beer. Great brunch spot (will be trying dinner another time). We had a cafe con leche martini and a mimosa which were delicious and strong. The charcuterie board had a nice variety. The summer salad and cheeseburger were very good. The music was‚Ä¶

OK y'all this ones gonna be a long one. I am so so happy I found this lil hidden in plain sight gem! We went for bae's birthday and let me tell you this place did not disappoint! From when we walked in we were amazed at the instant vibe. It's a wonderful size restaurant and beautifully decorated. There were a few people but it was fairly empty and our waitress told us we could pick our own seats. We opted to sit as close to the fireplace area as possible. I mentioned to our wonderful waitress that it was bae's birthday and she smiled and winked at me. From beginning to end our waitress was perfect! She showed the right amount of attention to us without being overbearing and annoying. She took her time explaining the menu and drink menu. (We're always looking for the strongest drinks on the menu lol)The menu has something wonderful for every one's price range. I went with the lamb chops and brussel sprouts(y'all know how much I love the sprouts) bae went with the salmon and veggies with mashed potatoes. While waiting for our food the bartender came over with complimentary glasses of Rose(idk if they do that all the time so don't go there expecting it and being mad at me if they don't lol) and it was dry and delicious we were pleasantly shocked lol. Then the food came and everything was perfectly seasoned and phenomenal! They really show you love and take care of you in there! They have happy hour from 4-7 so needless to say we will def be checking that out very soon! While we were sitting and talking the waitress came by and asked if we wanted to take pictures by the piano(insert happy face) she even remembered it was his bday and brought him a complimentary piece of cheesecake which was also delish and sang him happy birthday all by herself. This place is a ten out of ten! Run don't walk to Home BX Steakhouse!

The food was amazing, for appetizers we had The crab cake and burrata salad which were delicious. I had the porterhouse steak with whipped mashed potatoes. The steak was made to perfection. The service was impeccable. Great ambiance. I'm definitely coming back and highly recommend.

This restaurant is not a steak house. Upon arrival, I had to hunt for a hostess or server. Someone from the street went back to the kitchen to retrieve an employee. I ordered boeuf bourguignon, a dish rarely on menues as it take hours to make it properly.  What arrived, predictably, wasn't bourguignon. The whole point of bourguignon is the burgundy used to cook it and tenderize the meat, which takes hours to cook. First, you must caramelise the pearl onions for the flavour.  There were no onions. Also, you should serve it with wide egg noodles, not tough fettuccine pasta. I also had to ask for bread and butter. The bread was not warmed and invariably tough. I am being hard on this restaurant as we have few restaurants in the Bronx that are striving for excellence. This one needs to have its staff retrained and cooks and menues revised. It was unacceptable. Also, they need to add some ports to the wine list.
